text.section: Basic or added reparation benefits for medical expense are exempt from garnishment, attachment, execution, and any other process or claim, except upon a claim of a creditor who has provided products, services, or accommodations.
Basic reparation benefits other than those for medical expense are exempt from garnishment, attachment, execution, and any other process or claim.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 385, sec. 26, effective July 1, 1975.
